metadata.title: CVE-2024-3302 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
There was no limit to the number of HTTP/2 CONTINUATION frames that wouldbe processed. A server could abuse this to create an Out of Memorycondition in the browser. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125, FirefoxESR < 115.10, and Thunderbird < 115.10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-3302` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 125.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 125.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 125.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:115.10.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.10.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.10.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.10.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.10.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.10.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '125.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.10.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
